conclusion: Light source initially positioned to cast shadows A, B, C, and D.
A blue cylindrical object casting shadow A.
An egg-shaped object casting shadow B.
A black rectangular object casting shadow C.
A white rectangular object with protrusions casting shadow D.
Moving light source to back left shifts shadows towards front right.
Shadow A will move towards the front right.
Shadow B will move towards the front right.
Shadow C will move towards the front right.
Shadow D will move towards the front right.
Shadows increase in size due to more oblique angle of light rays.
Moving light source to back right shifts shadows towards front left.
Shadow A will move towards the front left.
Shadow B will move towards the front left.
Shadow C will move towards the front left.
Shadow D will move towards the front left.
Shadows increase in size due to more oblique angle of light rays.
Summary: Back left movement shifts shadows to front right and increases size.
Summary: Back right movement shifts shadows to front left and increases size.
Final Answer: Back left movement shifts shadows A, B, C, D to front right and increases size.
Final Answer: Back right movement shifts shadows A, B, C, D to front left and increases size.
